name: W Scottsdale

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel when you first arrive. The staff is helpful and friendly and everything is new. Do not allow them to book you in a room on the east or south side of the hotel unless you are a very early riser. Due to very poor engineering of the window treatment, every room on these sides get a blast of sunshine around 6:00 A.M.. To add more insult, the swank glass shower with window becomes a magnifying glass and radiates right onto the bed. If you are an early riser this might appeal. The staff is quite aware of this situation but will only offer a kind apology. When we were there, the 2nd floor pool was leaking into the reception driveway. If looking for rest, you need to find another hotel especially at the luxury rates. This hotel does not qualify as a luxury place.
reviews.title: Extreme Sunshine at 6:00 A.M.

likes.disliked: — Inability to darken the room in the A.M.

reviews.text: I visit the Phoenix/Scottsdale area on business a couple of times a year and being a loyal Starwood Preferred member, end up stayng staying in their hotels. This time around, I decided to try out the newly opened W.
reviews.title: You'll find better luxury hotels in Scottsdale

reviews.text: Was in great Phoenix area to cover NHL playoffs and chose a one night stay at W Scottsdale, which all my choices this month are as good. From the time I hit the valet until our early AM checkout, I was treated wonderfully. Was able to great a great rate for a Sunday evening for a spa suite and upon a very early arrival, the front desk (great dude from Philly named Chris) allowed me to check in early.
reviews.title: Great joint in Scottsdale

reviews.text: Spa suite had a very comfortable bed and lunch at the pool bar was great while we checked out end of NBA Clippers game. Upon returning the game later in the evening, we saddled up at the hotel bar to successfully end our trip. Was even worth the 45 minute drive across town to jobing.com Arena to stay in comfort.
reviews.title: Don't - Just Don't

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at many hotels in Scottsdale, and this is the worst. We stayed here because my husband had a conference here, but I really wish we hadn't.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: The room is the size of a postage stamp, and there is literally no bathroom - just a shower stall and a water closet that both open into the room, with a sink in between them. No drawers at all, no fridge, about 4 hangers in the closet (which is all that will fit). No bedside lamps. The bed feels like it is 25 years old, and it is small too. No outdoor space attached to the room, though there easily could have been, since there was an open area full of rocks right outside the window.
reviews.title: WOW at the W

reviews.text: Small is the general theme, since the pool is a wading pool, and hardly larger than a typical backyard pool. There is no shade to speak of, which is a problem when it is 107 out.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I failed to read this site until just hours before leaving to Scottsdale. If I had, I probably would have changed plans. Many who find the W Scottsdale to be loud, poorly run, and chaotic were dead on in their assessment. I knew we were in trouble when upon check in the desk clerk went on and on about how “happening” it was going to be on Friday and Saturday in the “club”. She actually told us that 1 to 2 thousand people per night would be lining up in the lobby to get in…..not an impressive point to me or my girlfriend, but it sure seemed to have her excited. She never did get us that map to downtown that she promised would be sent up.
reviews.title: Idiots Rule

reviews.text: We were there 4 nights total – I slept well only one of those nights and that was with the help of a sleep aid. Otherwise, you were guaranteed each night anywhere from 1:30 – 3:30 to hear drunken idiots in the hallways, talking or yelling and slamming doors with no regard that they were in a hotel where other guests may not want to be a part of their activities. The place seemed to me to be filled with self-absorbed 20 and 30 somethings that thought they were way cooler than they actually were. I despised the W Scottsdale and these people for that very reason.
reviews.title: Over-rated and over-priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking - $26 each and every night with no options anywhere nearby. This hotel is located right in the heart of the “entertainment district” so if there aren’t enough drunken idiots for you on the premises, you can walk less than a block to find plenty more. As a result, any public parking is either a 3 hour limit, or taken by those coming into the district for the evening. The W knows they have you on this point and are willing to take full advantage.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel! Loved the style. Highly recommend.

reviews.text: Our room was missed for cleaning completely the first day, regardless of the fact that we were not in the room at all from 8 am to 3:30 PM and then gone again for several hours after 5:15. There was no attempt to make good on this in any way when I called at 9:45 PM to report it. When they did clean it was half baked – I am certain that a broom or vacuum was not used the entire 4 days we were there as some crumbs on the floor that were there when we arrived, were still there when we left. Maybe it’s a once a week thing for them to vacuum???
reviews.title: W-eee little rooms.. W-ay inexperienced staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 2 nights. I'll start with the cons first. $23 a day parking (made me reluctant to tip valets). No tub in standard room only a shower. Mattress not the most comfortable. Standard view less than desireable, mostly parking garages and streets below. A better view can be upgraded for a fee. No hot tubs at pool area. Pricey. Now for the pros. New. Why should I pay the same for a refurbed hotel? Location second to none. One block from trolley cars (free) and newest malls. Room on the sixth floor very quite. Exceptionally friendly desk clerks and valets. Super clean rooms and facilities. Neat pool. I would be nervous with small children being for the fact that it is on the second floor with a hand rail up to the waist, much like a cruise ship I suppose. I might would stay there again, then again might look around. Overall not bad and new.
reviews.title: New and nice hotel

reviews.text: We were so impressed with the ambiance, amenities and design of Scottsdale's latest hot spot... but the hotel employees ruined it all. The customer service we received was nothing short of horrible... truly horrible. From the valet/bellman who expected us to transport our own bags upon arrival (we self-parked so apparently porterage service isn't available unless you register your car at the hotel), to the front desk who argued with us over the room type we reserved, to the concierge who informed us that the hotel does not have a supply of rollaway beds and that they must borrow them from other nearby hotels. Overall, the W Scottsdale staff treated us as if they were being inconvenienced by our presence. They acted as if they were doing us an undeserved favor by offering us any service at all. We were not made to feel welcome and our business was not appreciated in the slightest; with all of the other fun and trendy hotels in downtown Scottsdale we will take care to make a better selection for our next visit.
reviews.title: Wow! Wonderful hotel but WRETCHED service!!
Appeal for Simple Courtesy
reviews.text: I write this as a fellow service industry worker, with full scope and empathy for those who work to serve others' leisure activities. I know that I read and appreciate all the online reviews of my bar, and I only hope the staff at the W does the same.

I am a Scottsdale native, who attempted to go the the bar at the recently "new" W Hotel for the first time last night. It was the most unnerving and frustrating experience I've ever had just trying to enjoy a cocktail with some friends.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!

reviews.text: First the entrance is almost unidentifiable, as you have to enter through a rope (what is this, the Video Music Awards?!?). Standing in the entry way to the bar and hotel, were two security NON GENTLEMEN, who proceeded to flabbergast me in their treatment of me and my two girlfriends. They in turns, ignored us, patronized us, and ultimately would not welcome us into the hotel or bar. We are three, young, professional women looking to spend money (at a bar in a hotel that desperately needs it, I might add), and we were arbitrarily kept at bay. We are polite (although I'm sure that wore off with my patience), well dressed, composed women, and our money was being refused?! To really clinch my anger, through the entry way, I could see in to the bar and it was practically empty. It was incredibly disappointing to be treated the way we were. We left after some minutes later deciding we wanted to no longer subject ourselves to such treatment simply for the prospect of a nice cocktail at what we thought was a nice place.
reviews.title: Do NOT stay here for Business travel.

reviews.text: The hotel and the staff are excellent. It is a very trendy place to stay, but an even better place to let loose at night. We secured a VIP area for the evening's events and had nothing but excellent bottle service from Ashley. The music was great and the dancing even better - makes you wish you knew how to Salsa. The "scenery" is more beautiful than a Vancouver sunset. It is a bit of a fantasy setting, leaving you wanting to have the bar never close. So come to celebrate, and make a lasting memory, even if it is the last dance of the night.
reviews.title: The place to celebrate.

reviews.text: Where to begin:
reviews.title: Only party people should stay here

reviews.text: 1. While the hotel is very cool looking, it is not very comfortable. Rooms are small, as many hotels room are, but it is set up with bed in middle of the room, so very little room to move around the bed. There are three closet doors, but only one drawer to store clothes in (I was there for 5 days, so had a lot of clothes).
reviews.title: spring training at w scottsdale 2012
Nice hotel, good location. Beware of frosted glass showers . . . .
reviews.text: 2. Don't expect to sleep late. Shower is green frosted glass with frosted window to outside. Unfortunately, when the sun comes up (about 5:30 a.m. while I was there) the entire room is awash in light.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Don't expect to go to bed before 2 a.m. and get any sleep, especially if your room is by the pool. As mentioned in other reviews, the pool becomes a Vegas-style party venue every night, but it is particularly bad on Friday and Saturday nights. As well, the young adults who enjoy that also enjoy running around and yelling loudly on their way to their rooms at 2 or 3 a.m.
reviews.title: Trendy Hotel in Good Location

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel decorated with new modern style art and colors. Great place to party and socialize.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fairly small, but the bed was very comfortable and the shower was unique and big.
reviews.title: Comfy, trendy stay in good location

reviews.text: The pool itself is kind of small, but the pool deck area is very big with plenty of room to layout, rest, whatever. And the waitresses at the pool were top notch.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Spring Training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym consists of 2 elipticals, 2 treadmills and a couple of weight machines. Very small area and not nearly what i was expecting. But maybe they don't expect a lot of people to work out while staying there.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Hip Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overrall it was a very nice hotel but next time i might give another place a try.
reviews.title: First class for hip crowd.

reviews.text: From arrival to leaving this place all I could say is hip and trendy all the way!!! My friends and I came to Scottsdale for Spring Training and stayed here for the first two nights of our trip. Let's just say as SF Giants fans, we were happy to bump into Giants players poolside within two hours of us checking in.
reviews.title: Very trendy, but overrated.

reviews.text: The pool during the day and night was a fun place to hang out, relax, and have drinks. The downside was the service at the pool was lacking. The first day it took us having to seek out the servers rounding the pool after an hour to take our order....we actually walked to the bar just to get our drinks and food. The next day my friend didn't even get the food she ordered almost an hour and half after she ordered it. Luckily, they comped her food and her drink because of it.
reviews.title: This Hotel Should Be In Las Vegas

reviews.text: The room we stayed in was swanky, but really small. We had two beds in our room for four people, but it was hard to move around especially with the "modern" bathroom. We were actually relieved to move to another hotel which was larger and much better value.
reviews.title: Outstanding service and sushi, awfully small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily, my friends and I had a great time here because of Spring Training and other guests staying here, otherwise the actual hotel is overrated!
reviews.title: Cool and buzzing in downtown Scottsdale

reviews.text: If your looking for fun and upscale, this is the best hotel in Scottsdale. The pool scene rivals any big Las Vegas hotel like the Encore or Tao Beach. Our pool waitress Katie and Jill were amazing with their fast service and friendless. The front desk staff is very helpful and really want all their guest to have a wonderful experience. Thank you so much W Scottsdale for outstanding service and going above and beyond.
reviews.title: Trendy Scottsdale

description: Our luxury hotel is located in the heart of town offering a chic getaway in Arizona.
